title: Design Engineer
job_description:
About Adapt
Adapt is the AI brain of your business. It unifies every data source—databases, SaaS tools, support tickets, documents, and more—into a single conversational interface that delivers the highest level of intelligence the AI industry has to offer. Our autonomous agents continuously monitor KPIs, surface anomalies, diagnose root causes, and recommend next steps so organizations can act decisively. We serve startups and SMBs looking to move from endless dashboards and noisy AI to evidence-backed insight and action.

About the role
As Adapt’s Design Engineer, you’ll own the end-to-end experience across web and product UI - and ship it. You’ll design in Figma and implement in code (React/Next.js + Tailwind), building out a unified design system that powers both marketing and product. If you love moving from concept to pixels to production PRs and love going from 0 to 1, this is for you.
What you'll do
Product
Translate product concepts into clean, performant UI in Figma and GitHub
Build a scalable design system used across website and app
Implement designs in React/Next.js + Tailwind for the product and website
Collaborate closely with engineers to ship fast, accessible, responsive interfaces
Adapt web designs for mobile
Marketing & web
Own all design and implementation for Adapt.com, including shipping new pages, templates, and interactions
Assistance with customizing web CMS as needed
Create self-serve templates for campaigns, launch visuals, and sales decks (Figma)
Collaborate with brand designers or agencies to ensure consistency across all customer-facing touchpoints
Qualifications
3+ years in product or brand design with hands-on front-end implementation
Expert-level Figma skills
Comfortable with code. You can implement your own designs
Experience with Nextjs or other modern React frameworks
Experience with Tailwind and modern component libraries
Strong typography, layout, and visual storytelling
Track record of thriving in startup environments
Nice-to-Haves
Deep familiarity with Next.js
You’ve used AI-assisted workflows (Cursor, Claude Code, agents) to speed up design/engineering
Experience and interest in marketing and brand design in addition to product design
Located in the Bay Area
When it’s not a good fit
No experience using AI-assisted workflows in your day-to-day
Perfectionism regularly blocks speed

title: Full Stack Developer
job_description:
This is a remote role, but eligible candidates must reside in one of the following states: IN, MI, IL, OH, KY, TN, MN, MA, FL, GA, PA

Occasional travel is required once per year for our annual summit in Mishawaka, IN, or to client engagements. This position requires up to 30% travel, which may be outside the local area and overnight.

The anticipated salary range for this position is $50,000 to $70,000, depending on experience and qualifications, while our internal pay band for this role extends up to $90,000.

Pathfinders, a full-service integrated marketing agency, is looking for a Full Stack Developer who can build, connect, and maintain the digital products our clients rely on. At Pathfinders, developers aren’t just coders; they’re problem solvers who turn business goals into reliable, scalable, and high-performing digital experiences.

In this role, you’ll work across the stack: building responsive interfaces, writing clean back-end code, integrating APIs, and owning testing and QA before launch. You’ll also keep existing sites healthy with ongoing maintenance, security updates, and performance tuning. Collaboration is key: you’ll partner with designers, strategists, and account leads to ensure our work not only looks great but also functions seamlessly across systems.

This role is a great fit for someone who enjoys balancing front-end creativity with back-end logic, who gets just as much satisfaction from solving API challenges or database issues as from launching a site that delights clients.
And because we value curiosity, in the final application question, tell us your favorite framework, library, or digital tool (and why). We’re looking for developers who bring ideas and perspective, not just code.

You might be a great fit if you:
Set the Tone: You bring energy and clarity into every conversation. Even when things get tough, you make work feel doable, not draining.
Own the Outcome: You don’t just check boxes. You make sure the work connects to the bigger goal and moves projects forward.
Keep Growing: You stay curious, adapt quickly when things change, and see every challenge as a chance to get better.
We > Me: You believe great work is a team sport. You give credit generously, assume positive intent, and celebrate shared wins.

Get to know us at pathfind.com

What you will do, in greater detail:

Full Stack Development
Build responsive, accessible websites, landing pages, and digital products that follow UI/UX best practices
Write clean, efficient, testable code using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, and SQL or other server-side languages
Translate design files and functional specs into user-facing features and technical solutions
Web Maintenance
Monitor and maintain existing websites for performance, uptime, and security
Apply updates to CMS, plugins, frameworks, and libraries
Troubleshoot and resolve bugs or user-reported issues in a timely manner
API Integrations
Set up and maintain APIs that connect sites with CRMs, analytics, and other platforms (e.g., HubSpot, Salesforce, Google Analytics)
Manage WordPress and other CMS builds, customizations, and integrations
Document integrations and ensure consistent, secure data flow between systems
QA & Testing
Establish and run QA processes for new builds, updates, and releases
Test across devices, browsers, and environments to ensure a consistent experience
Track, report, and resolve defects before launch
Additional Responsibilities
Provide technical recommendations to internal teams and clients
Document code, systems, and workflows clearly
Support digital training sessions and maintain a library of components and features
Stay up to date on emerging web tools, trends, and compliance standards (ADA, WCAG 2.1, Section 508)
Complete timesheets daily with detailed notes
What we’d like to see in a strong candidate:
BSc. in Computer Science, Web Development, or related field
3–5+ years of full stack development experience, agency experience preferred
Strong expertise in front-end languages (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) and cross-browser compatibility
Proven proficiency in WordPress development and site management
Knowledge of server-side frameworks (PHP, ASP.NET, etc.) and database systems (SQL, Oracle)
Experience with API integrations and data flow across platforms
Familiarity with analytics tools (Google Analytics, Tag Manager, HotJar)
Ability to translate technical concepts into clear communication for teams and clients
Strong problem-solving skills with attention to detail and deadlines
Ability to work collaboratively across teams and independently on technical tasks
Adaptability and calm under shifting priorities
Strong written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to clearly and effectively collaborate with internal teams and clients

What's in it for you?
At Pathfinders, we believe people do their best work when they’re trusted, supported, and recognized. That’s why we offer more than just competitive compensation. We’ve built a total rewards philosophy around flexibility, performance, and long-term well-being. Our team enjoys the freedom to work remotely, generous time off (with employees averaging over six weeks annually), and opportunities to connect through our annual Summits. We cover a significant share of benefit costs, contribute to your HSA, and offer a 401(k) with automatic employer contributions (no employee contribution required). And because we believe great work should be rewarded, our quarterly bonus and profit-sharing programs reflect our commitment to shared success.

We embrace diversity as an advantage and believe firmly in the power of inclusivity. We provide all qualified applicants with equal employment consideration without regard to race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other protected status.

title: Website Builder
job_description:
Who We Are
Shae Group (Anthrophi Technologies Ltd, dba Shae Group) is a future-focused AI-first health and technology company operating across multiple verticals in wellness, education, technology, and enterprise services. We are building advanced ecosystems that combine human intelligence with AI precision. Every system we deploy—especially our websites and portals—must be fast, scalable, reliable, and designed to deliver exceptional user experiences.
Who You Are
You are a Website Builder with both technical know-how and an eye for clean, user-focused design. You thrive in high-performing, fast-moving environments and can transform concepts into functional, high-converting websites. You are equally comfortable with traditional platforms (WordPress, Webflow, Wix, Shopify) and AI-driven website builders, and you understand how to optimize for conversions, SEO, and speed.
You are:
Highly detail-oriented yet efficient.
Experienced with website builders and AI website creation tools.
A problem solver who can troubleshoot and optimize quickly.
Comfortable collaborating across Marketing, Sales, Partnerships, and Product teams.
Fluent in English, with strong written and spoken communication skills.
Proactive, organized, and committed to high-quality delivery.
The Role Overview
We are seeking a Website Builder to design, build, and maintain Shae Group’s websites, landing pages, sales funnels, and secure portals. This role is responsible for ensuring all sites are responsive, SEO-friendly, conversion-focused, and seamlessly integrated into our wider digital ecosystem.
The successful candidate will:
Build and maintain websites and sales funnels that meet brand and performance standards.
Use AI and automation tools to speed up workflows and optimize outputs.
Create Go High Level email templates for campaigns.
Integrate CRMs, analytics, and automation tools into all digital platforms.
Report on performance, conversion rates, and optimization outcomes.
Key Responsibilities
Website Development & Maintenance: Build and update websites, landing pages, and portals.
Design & UX: Implement clean, modern layouts with conversion-focused user journeys.
AI & Automation Integration: Leverage AI-driven tools and integrate CRMs, automation, and payment systems.
Content & Email Templates: Design and deploy email templates (HTML, Go High Level).
Performance Optimization: Ensure high site speeds, SEO compliance, and optimized funnels.
Quality Control & Documentation: Maintain version control, test rigorously, and document processes.
Requirements
3–5 years of hands-on experience in website development and design, with a portfolio demonstrating high-converting websites, landing pages, and funnels.
Proficiency with website builders such as WordPress, Webflow, Wix, Shopify, and familiarity with AI-driven website creation tools.
Strong knowledge of UX/UI design principles, conversion-focused layouts, and responsive/mobile-first design.
Experience with Go High Level (GHL) email template design and CRM-integrated campaigns.
Skilled in SEO best practices, site performance optimization, and analytics integration (e.g., Google Analytics/GA4).
Working knowledge of basic HTML, CSS, and JavaScript for customization and troubleshooting.
Ability to integrate CRMs, automation tools, and payment systems into websites and digital platforms.
Familiarity with A/B testing and optimization strategies for funnels and conversion rate improvements.
Detail-oriented, organized, and able to maintain version control and documentation for all projects.
Strong English communication skills—able to collaborate effectively across marketing, sales, partnerships, and product teams
Benefits
Base Monthly Fee: USD $1,000 – $1,600 (depending on experience).
Performance Incentives: Up to USD $600 per month based on KPI achievement.
Corporate Culture & Work Ethos
We foster a culture of innovation, performance, and purpose. Success is measured by outcomes, and we thrive in a fast-paced, AI-first environment. Transparency, collaboration, and high standards guide how we work, while our mission is to use technology for good, advancing health, wellbeing, education, and human performance.

title: WordPress Developer
job_description:
Job Overview
We are seeking a skilled WordPress Developer to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong foundation in web development, with expertise in WordPress and a variety of programming languages and frameworks. This role involves designing, developing, and maintaining websites while ensuring a seamless user experience. The successful applicant will collaborate with designers and other developers to create innovative solutions for our clients.
Responsibilities
Develop and maintain WordPress websites, ensuring high performance and responsiveness.
Collaborate with UX/UI designers to create user-friendly interfaces and engaging user flows.
Implement custom themes and plugins to enhance website functionality.
Optimize websites for SEO and ensure compliance with best practices in web design.
Utilize version control systems such as Git for code management.
Conduct unit testing and debugging to ensure quality assurance.
Work with various databases including MySQL, PostgreSQL, and MongoDB for data management.
Participate in Agile development processes, contributing to sprint planning and retrospectives.
Create wireframes and prototypes for new features or enhancements.
Stay updated on industry trends and emerging technologies to continually improve web development practices.
Experience
Proficiency in WordPress development, including theme customization and plugin development.
Strong knowledge of front-end technologies such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SCSS, and jQuery.
Familiarity with back-end technologies including PHP, Python, Ruby on Rails, or .NET frameworks.
Experience with RESTful APIs and web services integration.
Understanding of database management systems like MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server, SQLite, or MongoDB.
Knowledge of DevOps practices including CI/CD pipelines using tools like Jenkins or GitHub Actions.
Experience with cloud services such as AWS or Azure is a plus.
Familiarity with project management tools like Jira or Trello for task tracking.
Understanding of system architecture principles and software development lifecycle (SDLC).
Knowledge of responsive web design principles and e-commerce solutions is advantageous. Join our team to leverage your skills in a collaborative environment where creativity meets technology!
Job Type: Full-time

title: WordPress Architect-W2
job_description:
Role: WordPress Architect
Location: Remote
We are looking for a WordPress Architect to lead the architecture and implementation of high-scale, performance-driven WordPress solutions across multiple brand websites. This role requires deep expertise in WordPress multisite architecture, Gutenberg block-based editing, caching/CDN strategies, and authoring workflows.
Key Responsibilities
Architect and lead multisite WordPress platforms optimized for scalability, performance, and maintainability.
Design and implement a modular, reusable theme architecture to support multiple brands under a single multisite umbrella.
Define and optimize performance benchmarks including page load speed, Core Web Vitals, and server response time.
Collaborate with Cloudflare/DevOps teams to resolve cache invalidation issues (e.g., metadata not refreshing) and implement smart caching strategies.
Build and extend Gutenberg blocks to enable intuitive content creation and cross-site publishing.
Integrate WordPress with third-party systems (CRM, analytics, APIs, forms, personalization engines).
Drive the migration of legacy systems into a unified WordPress multisite or headless architecture.
Champion coding standards, CI/CD pipelines, security practices, and deployment workflows.
Work closely with UI/UX, SEO, and content teams to ensure brand consistency and editorial efficiency.
Requirements
Expertise in PHP, WordPress Core, custom themes, and plugin development.
Strong experience with WordPress multisite and block editor (Gutenberg) customization.
Deep understanding of performance optimization: object caching, page caching, lazy loading, asset bundling.
Experience solving cache/CDN challenges (e.g., Cloudflare) and implementing cache-busting strategies.
Familiarity with REST APIs, GraphQL, and headless WordPress (e.g., Next.js, Gatsby).
Knowledge of hosting platforms like WP Engine, Kinsta, or AWS/CloudFront.
Comfortable working with CI/CD pipelines, Git workflows, and deployment automation.
Excellent communication and stakeholder collaboration skills.
Nice to Have
Experience with Contentful, Strapi, or transitioning from WordPress to headless CMS.
Familiarity with accessibility (WCAG) and SEO best practices at scale.
Experience supporting multi-language or geo-targeted content across regions or brands.
Thanks & Regards
Muskan Harda
Team Lead
Helix Tech IT Services

title: Ruby Developer Advocate
job_description:
SerpApi is the leading solution to integrate search data into web applications. Our API scrapes search engines, solves CAPTCHAs, and keeps up with changing page layouts in one simple GET request. Our customers include Airbnb, Nvidia, Meta, Shopify, GrubHub and more.
We’re looking for a Ruby Developer Advocate to help expand our reach within the Ruby community. In this role, you’ll be the bridge between the community and our team—creating useful content, building example projects, maintaining our SDK, and helping SerpApi become the go-to API for scraping search engine results for Ruby developers around the world.
Responsibilities
Design and implement a developer-focused strategy to grow SerpApi’s presence in the Ruby community.
Create engaging content in various formats (blogs, videos, etc.) to educate and captivate our audience.
Regularly review customer interactions and issues to gain deeper insights into our product and users' needs.
Explore sponsorship and partnership opportunities across various channels.
Actively interact with potential users across various platforms to increase user acquisition.
Enhance our documentation to improve user engagement and understanding of our product.
Explore various tools, including no-code and low-code platforms, that can be integrated with SerpApi.
Attend and speak at meetups, conferences, or hackathons to build relationships with the developer community and grow SerpApi’s presence.
Solid experience with Ruby is required. Familiarity with a developer relations role and digital marketing is a plus.

Perks
SerpApi has been created by engineers for engineers. High compensation, transparency, remote-first, and a high trust environment are at the core of the company. All of these also make a very neurodivergent-friendly work environment. Several of our team members, including our CEO, are on the spectrum. Having a neurodivergent-friendly company is not an afterthought. We welcome talent from all over the world! No matter where you’re based, you can be part of our diverse, remote-first team. For those outside Austin, TX, we typically hire as independent contractors since we don't have an office there.
High Compensation
We offer high compensation, bonuses, and career opportunities all across the globe.
Competitive Worldwide
Total compensation, including profit shares, averages $232,448 per year per team member worldwide. We pay nearly as much as Google!
Profit Shares
All full-time team members receive profit share bonuses. We believe it's important to achieve alignment as a team.
Career Growth
Internal career paths, training (courses, conferences, books), and toolings (up to 50% reimbursement for software, hardware, subscriptions, and co-working space).
Transparency
A transparent world is a better world. Transparent organizations are more meaningful, connected to reality, and trustworthy.
Open Books
We share our books with all team members. We publish quarterly and annual reports (P&L, expenses).
Public Roadmap
Excluding security and confidential issues, all of our work is fully accessible to the public.
Internal Trust
Internally, we share analytics, customer interactions, hiring processes, strategies, marketing, and all other business-related data.
Remote-First Company
Remote is not a 2nd thought, but is core to SerpApi. All our processes are structured around being remote-first.
Even Before COVID
Remote-first wasn't a reaction to COVID, but was a conscious, long-term, and permanent decision.
Async Communications
All of our important communications are async, written, and online. We avoid unnecessary meetings as much as possible.
100% Online
We use the best tools for the job: GitHub, Slack, Pop, Zoom, Intercom, Figma, and emails.
High-Trust Environment
We put high-trust in everyone on our team and empower them to do their best work.
Flexible Schedule
Team members can adjust their own schedule, timezone, and unpaid vacation time the way they see fit.
Independent Prioritization
Outside of specifically assigned tasks, you can choose what work you think will produce the most value to SerpApi.
Trusted Contributions
All team members can suggest or directly make changes to anything related or not related to their jobs following their own judgment.
Send us your resume at careers@serpapi.com

100K - 125K a year + profit share

title: Full Stack Software Developer
job_description:
JDL Access is seeking a skilled Full Stack Developer to enhance and maintain Access Bridge, our case management platform for healthcare prior authorization and appeals workflows. You'll work across our modern React/Node.js/MongoDB stack to develop new features, optimize performance, and support client implementations in a HIPAA-compliant environment.
Key Responsibilities
Full Stack Development
· Develop and maintain a modern web application using:
o Frontend: React.js with JavaScript/TypeScript
o Backend: Node.js with Express.js framework
o Database: MongoDB with Mongoose ODM
o Authentication: Microsoft Authentication (OAuth 2.0 / JWT)
o Deployment: Heroku with CI/CD pipelines
· Build responsive user interfaces and intuitive user experiences
· Design and implement RESTful APIs and backend services
· Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code
· Conduct code reviews and follow development best practices
Feature Development & Enhancement
· Develop client dashboards, analytics features, and reporting tools
· Implement workflow automation and case management functionality
· Build custom forms, role-based access controls, and user management features
· Create data visualization components and performance metrics displays
· Integrate third-party services and APIs as needed
Database & Performance
· Design and optimize MongoDB schemas and queries
· Implement data migration scripts and validation processes
· Monitor application performance and implement optimizations
· Manage database indexing and query performance tuning
Client Implementation Support
· Customize platform features for specific client workflows and requirements
· Support data migrations from legacy systems
· Collaborate with product and QA teams on feature specifications
· Troubleshoot technical issues and provide solutions
DevOps & Deployment
· Manage CI/CD pipelines using GitHub Actions and Heroku
· Deploy applications across development, staging, and production environments
· Monitor application health and implement logging solutions
· Ensure security best practices in deployment processes
Security & Compliance
· Implement HIPAA-compliant features and data handling
· Develop secure authentication and authorization systems
· Maintain data encryption and access controls
· Support security audits and compliance requirements
Required Technical Skills
· Frontend: Proficiency in React.js, JavaScript (ES6+), TypeScript, HTML5, CSS3
· Backend: Strong experience with Node.js, Express.js, RESTful API development
· Database: MongoDB, Mongoose ODM, database design principles
· Version Control: Git workflow and GitHub collaboration
· Tools & Deployment:
o Heroku deployment and pipeline management
o GitHub Actions for CI/CD
o Package managers (npm/yarn)
o Testing frameworks (Jest, React Testing Library)
· Security: Understanding of JWT, OAuth2, RBAC, and web security principles
Preferred Experience
· 3+ years of full stack development experience
· Experience with healthcare or regulated industry applications
· Knowledge of data visualization libraries (Chart.js, D3.js, Recharts)
· Familiarity with logging and monitoring tools (LogDNA, Sentry, Papertrail)
· Experience with cloud platforms (Azure, AWS) and identity providers
· Understanding of HIPAA compliance and healthcare data standards
· Agile development methodologies and project management tools
Soft Skills & Experience
· Strong problem-solving and debugging skills across the full stack
· Excellent written and verbal communication skills
· Experience working with cross-functional teams (Product, QA, Compliance)
· Ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions
· Comfortable working independently in a remote environment
· Detail-oriented with strong testing and quality assurance mindset
Compensation & Benefits
· Salary Range: $90,000 - $110,000
· Annual bonus and raise eligibility
· Remote-first team with flexible working hours
· Full health/dental/vision benefits
· Paid time off and company holidays
· Professional development opportunities
To Apply
Submit a resume and cover letter highlighting your full stack development experience, particularly with React/Node.js/MongoDB applications. Please include GitHub portfolio or code samples demonstrating your frontend and backend development skills. Experience with healthcare platforms or SaaS applications is a plus.

Pay: $90,000.00 - $110,000.00 per year

401(k) 3% Match

title: Senior Frontend Developer
job_description:
Front End Developer
Remote
We are seeking a talented Front-end Developer with a strong technical foundation and a user-focused mindset to join our team. In this role, you will build and maintain high-performance web applications using modern JavaScript frameworks and technologies. Your passion for clean, efficient code and commitment to exceptional user experience will be essential as you work collaboratively with designers, backend developers, and product teams to bring digital experiences to life.
As a skilled problem-solver who approaches technical challenges methodically, you will deliver high-quality solutions that meet both user needs and business objectives. Your work will be essential in delivering fast, reliable, and engaging web applications to our users.
Key Responsibilities
Front-end Development
· Build responsive, interactive web applications using React JS, Next JS, and modern JavaScript (ES6+)
· Translate design mockups and wireframes into functional, accessible web applications
· Build reusable, modular UI components and contribute to component libraries
Code Quality & Performance
· Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code following established coding standards and best practices
· Optimize applications for maximum speed and scalability, including bundle optimization, lazy loading, and code splitting
· Identify and resolve front-end issues, bugs, and performance bottlenacks
Testing & Quality Assurance
· Write and maintain unit tests, integration tests, and end-to-end tests to ensure application reliability
· Ensure consistent functionality and appearance across different browsers and devices
· Ensure web applications meet accessibility standards (WCAG, ADA) and are usable by all users
Collaboration & Development Practices
· Manage code using Git, including branching strategies, pull requests, and code reviews
· Participate in code reviews, provide constructive feedback, and mentor junior developers
· Actively participate in sprint planning, daily standups, retrospectives, and other agile ceremonies
· Work closely with UX/UI designers and backend developers to deliver seamless user experiences
Continuous Learning
· Stay current with front-end technologies, frameworks, and industry best practices
· Research and evaluate new tools and technologies to improve development processes
Required Qualifications
· Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or equivalent professional experience
· 3+ years of experience in front-end development with strong JavaScript fundamentals
· Proficiency in React JS, HTML5, CSS3, and modern JavaScript (ES6+)
· Experience with Next JS and server-side rendering concepts
· Strong understanding of responsive design principles and CSS frameworks (Tailwind CSS preferred)
· Experience with version control systems (Git) and collaborative development workflows
· Understanding of web performance optimization techniques and browser developer tools
· Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
· Strong communication skills and ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams
Preferred Qualifications
· Experience with TypeScript for type-safe JavaScript development
· Knowledge of testing frameworks (Jest, React Testing Library, Cypress)
· Familiarity with modern CSS-in-JS solutions or CSS preprocessors (Sass, Less)
· Experience with headless CMS integration and JAMstack architecture
· Understanding of SEO principles and implementation techniques
· Knowledge of web accessibility standards and assistive technologies
· Experience with mobile-first development and Progressive Web Apps (PWAs)
· Familiarity with backend technologies and full-stack development concepts
· Portfolio demonstrating front-end projects with emphasis on code quality, performance, and user experience

title: JavaScript Developer
job_description:
Overview:
Edgewater Federal Solutions is seeking a highly motivated and dedicated JavaScript Developer to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will assist in enhancing the overall functionality of software by improving software architecture, supporting existing software, and engineering hardware components that optimize various technologies.
This role involves providing technical support to clients, testing applications, maintaining hardware, and responding to customer requests. The Junior JavaScript Developer will also analyze complex system requirements, design software tools and subsystems, and manage software development and support processes. You will manage software development and support using formal specifications, data flow diagrams, other accepted design techniques, and Computer Aided Software Engineering (CASE) tools. Additionally, you will estimate software development costs and schedules, review existing programs, and assist in making refinements that reduce operating time and improve current techniques.
Responsibilities:
Collaborate with team members to investigate, plan, gather requirements, design, develop, test, document, analyze problems, and support software systems and applications.
Support the design of software tools and subsystems that support reuse and domain analysis, assisting Applications Engineers and Programmers in interpreting software requirements and design specifications, coding, integrating, and testing software components to ensure they meet project objectives.
Analyze functional business applications and design specifications across various areas, including finance, accounting, personnel, manpower, logistics, and contracts.
Develop block diagrams and logic flow charts, translating detailed designs into computer software, testing, debugging, and refining software to produce high-quality products.
Prepare comprehensive documentation and enhance software to improve efficiency while providing technical direction to programmers to ensure project deadlines are met.
Experience in information system design, including application programming on large-scale database management systems and the development of complex software to satisfy design objectives.
Writing, documenting, and maintaining high-quality code for web applications using JavaScript (React, Next.js, Node).
Collaborating with customers and stakeholders to gather and define application requirements.
Testing, debugging, and refactoring frontend and backend web application code to ensure optimal performance.
Participating in code reviews and providing constructive feedback to team members.
Developing and maintaining technical documentation, including design specifications and user manuals.
Assisting in the deployment of applications and monitoring their performance in production environments.
Engaging in continuous learning and staying updated with industry trends and best practices in software development.
Working closely with cross-functional teams to integrate software solutions with existing systems and technologies.
Providing technical support and troubleshooting assistance to users facing issues with applications and hardware.
Qualifications:

title: Founding Full-Stack App Developer (UX/UI + Startup Experience)
job_description:
Everyone has a story worth telling. At Co Author, we’re building an AI-powered platform to make storytelling simple, accessible, and inspiring — even for people who don’t see themselves as “writers.” The mission is big: unlock voices and experiences that too often go unheard.
We’re not looking for just another developer. We’re looking for someone who’s hungry to build fast, own the product, and help shape a company from day one. If you’ve launched apps before, love wearing multiple hats, and thrive in startup chaos — this is your shot.
Does the idea of building and shipping an MVP that changes how people create light a fire in you? Do you want to be part of the founding team and actually get after it?
About the Role
You’ll own the build end-to-end: front end, back end, and UX/UI. From the first prototype to the public launch, you’ll be at the center of it all, working directly with the founders to turn vision into reality.
What You’ll Do
Build and launch the app (iOS/Android or cross-platform).
Own front end (UI/UX) and back end (databases, APIs, integrations).
Prototype, ship, and iterate with speed — “done” beats “perfect.”
Work side by side with founders on product and roadmap.
Be the jack-of-all-trades who makes the app real.
What We’re Looking For
Proven full-stack developer with apps shipped from zero to market.
Strong mobile framework skills (React Native, Flutter, or similar).
Hands-on UX/UI design experience.
Startup mindset: fast-moving, resourceful, thrives under pressure.
Passion for building meaningful products that empower creativity and storytelling.
Why Join Us
This is a ground-floor role. You won’t just code — you’ll shape the product, the user experience, and the company itself. If you’ve been waiting for a chance to pour your skills into something real, meaningful, and high-impact — this is it. Let’s build it together.
Job Type: Part-time
Projected Total Compensation: $50.00 - $150.00 per hour
Expected hours: 10 – 40 per week
Work Location: Remote

title: Senior Frontend Software Engineer
job_description:
About Mytra:
We’re creating an entirely new way to solve the most ubiquitous problem in industry - moving and storing material. We’re applying robotics and distributed software to create a new class of product for this $1T market. We’re focused on the supply chain industry first. The industry is in a massive bind with the continued growth of e-commerce, sharp rise in costs, and supply chain disruptions. What has been a “sleepy” industry for decades is now at the epicenter of sustaining the global economy.

About the role:
Mytra’s Software team is looking for a senior frontend software engineer to develop and scale the user interfaces that enable the users of our system. In this role you will work cross-functionally with software and firmware engineers to develop intuitive, visually compelling, and highly performant UIs that redefine the experience in this industry . Our team is focused on development of functional, reliable, and performant software.

Responsibilities:
Lead and mentor the development of user interfaces using React, Typescript, Websockets, and other modern web technologies
Develop automated tests to ensure high-quality software releases and accurate functionality
Work closely with cross-functional partners in robotics and infrastructure
Deliver high-quality code in a variety of on-premises and cloud environments
Design, implement, test, and document software
Qualifications:
Strong experience with common frontend languages, strong recent TypeScript/Javascript experience preferred
Experience with React and a deep understanding of its paradigms
Experience with Progressive Web Apps and oﬄine mode
Experience developing highly available, high reliability systems
Experience building responsive UIs for a variety of physical devices (i.e. laptops, TVs, iPads)
Familiarity with unit testing, integration testing, regression testing, functional testing, etc.
Excellent problem solving, critical thinking, and communication skills
Sense of ownership and a collaborative approach to developing software within a team
Iterative approach to software development
Desire to continue learning and growing
Git experience
A Final Note:
You’re encouraged to apply even if you can’t take on every example project in its totality. We
work closely and collaboratively at Mytra - No one takes on projects alone. We seek people who
are eager to work together, learn new things, and bring unique perspectives.

Benefits Include:
Competitive compensation + equity grants at a high growth company backed by top tier VCs
Medical, dental, vision, 401(k), commuter benefits, and pet insurance
Lively modern combined office and lab space where we rapidly iterate through design, build and test phases
Lunch and snacks provided in the office; we eat and share stories together at the “long” table
Flexible hours and flexible PTO
Pay Notice:
Compensation for this position will be negotiated based on the candidate's experience level and location. The posted salary band is applicable only to the San Francisco Bay Area and is subject to change.

title: Guidewire Digital Lead Developer
job_description:
Position Description:
Join CGI as a Guidewire Digital Lead Developer, where youll take the lead on cutting-edge digital initiatives and play a key role in shaping innovative solutions for our clients. In this client-facing position, youll provide technical leadership and hands-on expertise across Guidewire Edge components, with opportunities to work closely with PolicyCenter and other Guidewire platforms.

Mentor offshore and junior team members, ensuring adherence to CGI's SDLC standards.

Ensure deliverables are completed with quality and on time, acting as the technical authority for Guidewire Digital.

5+ years of Guidewire Digital development experience, with proven expertise in Edge.
Strong knowledge of CustomerEngage Quote and Buy.
Experience in a Tech Lead or Lead Developer role on Guidewire Digital projects.

Broader Guidewire suite knowledge (e.g., BillingCenter, ClaimCenter).
Experience mentoring distributed teams across onshore/offshore delivery.


This position is located in Birmingham, AL in a hybrid environment.

CGI anticipates accepting applications for this position through October 31, 2025.

CGI is required by law in some jurisdictions to include a reasonable estimate of the compensation range for this role. job_description:
Company Overview
At NewRich Network, we empower digital entrepreneurs to turn their dreams into reality. Our mission is simple yet bold: to help people create a balanced, fulfilling lifestyle – while building wealth and independence along the way.
We’re a fast-growing team driven by one vision: a world where anyone can work remotely, chase their passion, and live life on their own terms.
Our platform combines SaaS tools, e-learning programs, and a supportive social network – a one-stop ecosystem designed for creators, entrepreneurs, and dreamers who want more than just a career.
We believe fulfilling work and a healthy work-life balance is key to living a NewRich Lifestyle.
If you’re motivated, ambitious, and ready to grow with us, we want to hear from you!
Stack: 80% PHP (Laravel, MySQL) / 20% React.
Requirements
5+ years as Software Developer with proven project track record.
Strong knowledge of PHP 8, Laravel 9+, MySQL, React.js 18.2 (or any other frontend framework).
Experience with HTML/CSS/JS, RESTful APIs, Git.
Docker/Kubernetes, AWS (or similar cloud).
Solid database design and optimization skills.
Strong problem-solving, communication, and ability to work independently.

Good understanding of web app security.
Fluency in English (written & spoken).

WebRTC, FFMPEG, HLS, SRT, RTMP, DRM.
Node.js/Express, GitHub Actions.
NoSQL (MongoDB, Redis).
DevOps practices.

Self-driven, motivated, reliable in a fast-paced environment.

Develop and maintain server-side applications (PHP 8, Laravel, MySQL).
Build and optimize APIs, ensure performance, scalability, and security.
Implement front-end features with React.js (18.2).
Work with CI/CD pipelines, automated testing, and code reviews.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, mentor juniors.
Manage integrations between systems and cloud services (AWS).

Benefits
Paid Adventure Time – Take an all-expenses-paid remote working trip for 3 weeks to a destination of your choice with one of our remote work-trip partners. On top of that, you’ll have “Me-Days” – flexible personal days you can take whenever you need a reset.

Unlimited Learning – You’ll get full access to every course and program on our NewRich platform. We invest in your growth because your growth fuels ours.

We’d love to hear from you!

title: Fullstack Developer at Firefly Lab
job_description:
Job Posting: Fullstack Developer at Firefly Lab
Location: Remote
Type: Full-Time (but part-time or consulting roles are also available)
Salary: Competitive, based on experience
About Firefly
At , we’re revolutionizing competency-based medical education by building the data science foundation to train doctors. Although many jobs posts claim a company to be revolutionizing a field, in this case it’s definitely true. We have contracts with multiple medical boards for national-scale projects, and we founded the academic field of epistomics (“episteme” + “omics”), a big-data computational strategy for optimizing education and human performance. Our mission is to empower medical and surgical education with innovative technology for accelerating learning in busy hospital settings, and ensuring healthcare professionals are equipped with the skills and knowledge to excel in patient care. Join our passionate team to make a meaningful impact on the future of medicine!
The Role
We’re seeking a talented Fullstack Developer to design, develop, and maintain scalable web applications that power our educational platform. You’ll work closely with our data science and education teams to create intuitive tools that support medical training and competency assessment.
Key Responsibilities
Design and implement responsive, user-friendly front-end interfaces using Svelte (or Vue, React, or similar frameworks if desired).
Develop robust back-end services and APIs using Sveltekit fullstack framework (or NodeJS).
Manage and optimize relational databases (PostgreSQL) to ensure data integrity and performance.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate data science models into the platform.
Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code following best practices. (We love to keep things simple and straightforward.)
Contribute to system architecture decisions and ensure scalability and reliability.
Participate in code reviews, testing, and deployment processes, but without extra bureaucratic process or burdensome extra meetings.
What We’re Looking For
Friendly and easy to work with.
Comfort with working remotely.
Experience:
2+ years of professional experience as a Fullstack Developer or similar role.
Strong proficiency in NodeJS for back-end development.
Experience in Svelte or another modern front-end framework (e.g. Vue, React, Solid).
Experience with PostgreSQL or another relational database (e.g., MySQL, MariaDB).
Familiarity with RESTful APIs or similar technologies.
Knowledge of version control systems (e.g., Git) and CI/CD pipelines.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
Passion for education and healthcare technology is a plus!
Nice-to-Haves
Experience with configuring an application on AWS or other cloud platforms (e.g., Azure, GCP).
Understanding of security best practices for web applications.
Some knowledge of containerization (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
Familiarity with data science tools or workflows (e.g., Python, Pandas, Jupyter, PyTorch).
Any experience with medical electronic health record (EHR) systems, especially data integrations with EHR systems.
Why Join Firefly?
Be part of a mission-driven team transforming medical education.
Work on cutting-edge technology that has a significant positive impact.
Enjoy a flexible, remote-friendly work environment.
Collaborate with a diverse team of engineers, data scientists, physicians, and educators.
Competitive salary, benefits, and opportunities for growth.
How to Apply
If you’re excited about building technology that shapes the future of medical education, we’d love to hear from you! Please submit your resume and a brief cover letter to jobs@fireflylab.org.
Firefly is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Contract
Work Location: Remote

title: DevOps Engineer
job_description:
About the project
At https://spacedev.io/, we partner with world-class startups and enterprises to launch disruptive digital products.
We’re looking for talented DevOps Engineers to collaborate with engineering teams working on MERN-based platforms (MongoDB, Express, React, Node.js), ensuring seamless delivery, scalability, and reliability.
You’ll play a key role in improving development workflows, automating deployments, and enabling teams to ship faster and safer.
Who we’re looking for
A DevOps Engineer passionate about CI/CD, automation, and reliability, who thrives in collaborative environments and enjoys solving complex challenges. You’ll join a multicultural, remote-first team, contributing directly to products used by thousands of users worldwide.
Tech stack
Languages & Scripting: Python, Bash, JavaScript (Node.js)
Application stack: MERN (MongoDB, Express, React, Node.js)
CI/CD: GitHub Actions (main), GitLab CI, Jenkins (plus)
Containers & Orchestration: Docker, Kubernetes (EKS/GKE/AKS)
Cloud: AWS (preferred), GCP or Azure
IaC: Terraform (preferred), Ansible (plus)
Monitoring & Logging: Prometheus, Grafana, Loki, ELK/EFK
Collaboration: GitHub, ClickUp, Slack
What you’ll do
Design and maintain CI/CD pipelines for MERN-based applications and microservices.
Automate testing, builds, and deployments across multiple environments.
Support developers with tooling, infrastructure, and delivery best practices.
Monitor applications and services, creating dashboards and actionable alerts.
Implement security practices across repositories, pipelines, and environments.
Participate in incident management, root-cause analysis, and postmortems.
Document and standardize DevOps practices across the team.
What you need
3+ years of experience in DevOps / SRE roles.
Strong experience with CI/CD (preferably GitHub Actions).
Solid knowledge of Docker and Kubernetes.
Hands-on experience with AWS or GCP.
Scripting skills in Python or Bash.
Familiarity with monitoring systems (Prometheus, Grafana, ELK/EFK).
Strong communication skills and ability to work with distributed teams.
Bonus points for
Previous experience working with MERN stack applications.
Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, Ansible).
Experience with GitOps tools (ArgoCD, Flux).
Background in fintech, blockchain, or AI-driven projects.
Familiarity with Atlassian tools (Jira, Confluence).
Interested?
Join us to build cutting-edge digital products in a remote, multicultural team. You’ll be working in a collaborative environment with opportunities for growth, impact, and continuous learning.
Tipo de puesto: Tiempo completo
Sueldo: $30,000.00 - $65,000.00 al mes
Lugar de trabajo: Empleo remoto

title: Founding Engineer
job_description:
Founding Engineer for Live Commerce Shopify App

What We're Building

A live streaming shopping platform for Shopify merchants. Think QVC meets Instagram Live—merchants broadcast live video while showcasing products, and viewers can buy in real-time during the stream.

This is a greenfield project with a complete PRD. We know exactly what we're building; we need a founding engineer to help build it.

What Makes This a Founding Role
You'll work directly with the CTO, building this from the ground up
Your architectural input will shape the product
Real ownership over features and technical decisions
Opportunity to grow with the company as we scale
Well-compensated with room for rate increases as we prove out the model

Working Style We Need
Ship fast, iterate often - We want working features weekly, not perfect code monthly
AI-forward - You use AI tools to move faster, handle boilerplate, and explore solutions quickly
Collaborative - You're comfortable with pair programming, code reviews, and technical discussions
Independent - You can own features end-to-end without constant direction
Pragmatic - You know when to build custom vs. use a library, when to optimize vs. ship

What You Won't Be Doing
Designing the product (PRD is complete)
DevOps complexity (Railway handles deployments)
Fighting with Docker locally (we don't use it)
Working in isolation (you'll collaborate daily with the CTO)

Ideal Candidate
You've built a Shopify app before, and it wasn't your first rodeo with real-time features. You're comfortable owning significant parts of the codebase but also enjoy collaborating with another technical co-founder. You use AI tools heavily but know when to override them. You've shipped products that real users depend on.

You might be a senior IC looking for a well-paid founding opportunity, a technical founder between projects, or an experienced developer ready to help build something from zero to one.

Project Scope
Timeline: 8-24 weeks to MVP, with potential for long-term engagement
Commitment: Full-time (40+ hours/week) - we're moving fast
Location: Fully remote, any timezone
Compensation: Competitive hourly rate for senior-level talent
Team: You'll work directly with the CTO

To Apply
Send us:
Portfolio/GitHub - Show us Shopify apps or real-time features you've built
Your AI workflow - What tools do you use and how?
One question - What's your first question about the technical approach?
Rate & timing - What you charge and when you can start

No cover letters, no fluff. Just show us you can do the work.
Compensation:
$25 - $50 hourly
Responsibilities:
What You'll Be Building
A merchant dashboard to control live streams (switch products, monitor sales, moderate chat)
A customer-facing stream viewer page (watch live video, see featured products, participate in chat)
Real-time features connecting everything together (product updates, live chat, viewer counts)
The full stream lifecycle (setup go live end stream
analytics)

What You Won't Be Doing
Designing the product (PRD is complete)
DevOps complexity (Railway handles deployments)
Fighting with Docker locally (we don't use it)
Working in isolation (you'll collaborate daily with the CTO)

The Stack
Frontend: Remix (React Router 7)
Backend: Node.js with real-time WebSockets
Database: PostgreSQL + Redis
Video: Mux streaming
Hosting: Railway
Platform: Shopify embedded app
Qualifications:
Strong React/TypeScript skills - This is a modern React app with complex state management
Real-time/WebSocket experience - You've built chat apps, collaborative tools, or live dashboards before
High-volume application experience - You've built apps handling thousands of concurrent users with real-time updates
Shopify app development - You've built at least one Shopify embedded app and understand their ecosystem
PostgreSQL comfort - You can design schemas and write efficient queries
AI-assisted development - You're a power user of Claude, Cursor, Copilot, or similar tools
About Company

LeftLane Marketing is a specialized marketing agency that partners with some of the largest automotive YouTube influencers in the world. We help creators monetize their following by building and managing Shopify stores, designing merchandise, running vehicle giveaways, and managing multi-platform digital ad campaigns. Our firm has over 10 years of experience creating some of the largest vehicle giveaway brands on the internet.

title: Senior Full Stack Developer
job_description:
Description:
Company Overview:
STP Investment Services is a collaborative partner providing scalable and transparent front, middle, and back office solutions to investment managers, funds, and plan sponsors giving them the technology, expertise and confidence needed to focus on core business objectives. STP Investment Services, an international company with fully owned offices in the United States and India, provides a broad range of services for the asset management industry with capabilities to process all asset classes and meet ever-evolving business requirements.
STP employees enjoy the following benefits:
Competitive compensation and commission program
Unlimited PTO policy in addition to your birthday as a free day off!
401k Matching program
Competitive health benefits (Medical, Vision, Dental, Life, and Disability Insurance)
Volunteer Time Off (VTO). We pay you to do good in your community!
Strong growth and advancement opportunities
The Full Stack Developer will have a strong background in both front-end and back-end technologies, with a passion for building scalable, high-quality and high-performance applications. This individual will require a deep understanding of web development, from concept to deployment, and the ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
The successful candidate will have at least 5 years of proven experience with designing, developing, and deploying scalable applications in the cloud. The ideal candidate will be fluent in both front-end and back-end development, with a solid background in cloud architecture—preferably within Microsoft Azure. This role will work closely with Product managers, DevOps, and QA teams to deliver secure, efficient, and high-performing solutions.
Essential Functions:
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Design, build, and maintain full-stack applications (front-end, back-end, APIs, databases).
Develop and deploy scalable, secure, and reliable solutions using Azure services (App Services, Functions, Azure SQL, Storage, Event Hub, Service Bus, etc.).
Implement CI/CD pipelines and support DevOps practices.
Collaborate in troubleshooting and optimizing cloud applications for performance and cost efficiency.
Strong understanding of Agile principles and how to translate them into day-to-day engineering practices
Apply security best practices across application development and cloud infrastructure.
Stay up to date on emerging technologies, frameworks, and tools to improve engineering practices.
Build and enhance user interfaces using front-end frameworks such as React.
Assist with infrastructure ensuring that all servers are correctly set-up, configured, and maintained for optimal performance and security.
Continuously improve existing applications and processes to enhance efficiency and performance.
Actively participate in sprint ceremonies with a continuous improvement mindset core to STP’s working culture.
Requirements:
Minimum of 5-7 years in full stack development, with at least 2+ years working in a cloud-native environment.
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent experience of education and experience.
Proven experience as a Full Stack Developer or similar role.
Proficient in modern JavaScript/Typescript (ES6+), HTML5, and CSS3.
Experience with React JS Library, including hooks, context, and component lifecycle.
Back-end development skills with Node.js and Express.
Hands-on experience with cloud platforms (Azure preferred, but AWS or GCP acceptable).
Knowledge of web security practices and protocols.
Proven ability to work quickly in a dynamic environment with strong attention to detail and accuracy.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.
Technical Skills:
Strong proficiency in modern web development frameworks (e.g., React, Angular, or Vue).
Back-end expertise with Node.js, .NET, Python, or Java.
Database knowledge (SQL Server, PostgreSQL, Cosmos DB, or similar).
Proven experience with Azure cloud services; AWS/GCP experience also a plus.
Experience with containers and orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes/AKS).
Familiarity with DevOps tools (GitHub Actions, Azure DevOps, Terraform, Ansible, etc.).
Soft Skills: Strong problem-solving abilities, collaboration, and communication skills; ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.
Preferred Experience
Azure certifications (AZ-204, AZ-305, or similar).
Background in microservices architecture and serverless computing.
Experience with API design and integration.
Knowledge of cloud security frameworks and compliance standards.
Competencies:
Front-End Development (React)
Proficient in TypeScript and React, with clean, maintainable coding practices
Strong understanding of React Hooks and component lifecycle
Experience implementing OAuth 2.0 login flows (Azure AD B2C preferred)
Familiarity with Tailwind CSS for rapid UI development
Experience with React Query and consuming RESTful APIs
Back-End Development (Node.js)
Experience building scalable back-end services with TypeScript and Express
Familiarity with PDF generation (Apryse or equivalent libraries is a plus)
Cloud and Azure Administration
Strong understanding of cloud environments and core Azure services
Experience with Blob Storage, IAM fundamentals, and Azure AD tenant management
Knowledge of pricing tiers, resource groups, and service credentials
Experience managing Azure API Management (APIM) and App Services
Additional (Nice to Have)
Basic experience with Angular components and lifecycle management as part of legacy applications.
Ability to build and integrate RESTful APIs using Angular front-ends

title: Remote Part-Time - Experienced Haskell Developer
job_description:
Join our Haskellers team at Stack Builders! We’re looking for an experienced functional programming engineer to support a long-term project that is almost entirely built in Haskell. This is a staff augmentation role where you’ll contribute to the development and optimization of a mission-critical application with high scalability and data integrity requirements.
Innovation is at the heart of Stack Builders. Our cross-cultural development team pushes the boundaries of functional programming by building applications that consistently exceed expectations, while adhering to best practices in communication, teamwork, and continuous improvement.
We’re seeking a part-time remote contractor (20–30 hours per week) with strong Haskell expertise and the ability to collaborate on database and infrastructure enhancements. This role requires a proactive professional who thrives in fast-paced environments and takes pride in delivering robust, high-quality code.
Requirements
Advanced English (spoken and written). You will be directly communicating with the client.
Must be able to work as an independent contractor. For candidates based in the US, an LLC, S-Corp, or C-Corp structure is required
5+ years of professional Haskell experience with outstanding programming skills.
Strong experience with Yesod and database-related libraries (Persistent, Esqueleto).
Solid background in writing clean, testable, and scalable code.
Experience applying property-based testing.
Strong collaboration and problem-solving skills with excellent verbal and written communication.
Availability to work 20–30 hours per week and overlap 4 hours with EDT.
Bonus: Frontend experience with TypeScript/React.
Responsibilities
Architect and build backend solutions in Haskell (95% of work).
Implement and optimize database operations (Persistent, Esqueleto).
Collaborate on infrastructure enhancements to ensure scalability and performance.
Contribute to code quality practices, including property-based testing (QuickCheck, related libraries).
Occasionally collaborate on frontend components with TypeScript (e.g., React, jQuery, Bootstrap, Webpack).
Participate in agile rituals: stand-ups, sprint planning, retrospectives.
Engage directly with the client during rituals, providing updates, gathering requirements, and ensuring alignment with their needs.
The projected hourly range for this position is from $47.00 to $57.00/ hour, determined by the candidate's interview outcome, skills, experience, education, and alignment with market data.
Benefits
100% remote work modality.
A human-centered experience, as we’re a people-first company.
Challenging, exciting and long-term projects. We work with some of the most admired companies worldwide.
A strong learning culture. You’ll have opportunities for 1:1 sessions with your manager.
Regular pairing sessions. You’ll develop high-quality code while sharing knowledge with your team members.
Opportunities for company-sponsored conference participation, OSS contributions, tutorials, blog posts, and technical talks.
Exceptionally talented and passionate coworkers.
Timely payments, with the flexibility to choose the payment date modality that best suits your needs.
A Stack Builders community to support you and learn with you!

title: Full-Stack Developer — UI-Heavy (Accessibility & Complex Workflows)
job_description:
Full-Stack Developer — UI-Heavy (Accessibility & Complex Workflows)
Remote | Full-Time |(reports to Technical Lead)
About the Role
We’re looking for a Full-Stack Developer with strong frontend expertise in React/TypeScript and experience building accessible, complex UIs. You’ll deliver features like multi-step forms, data-dense tables, and visualizations that meet WCAG 2.1/508 standards, while also contributing to backend (Node/Java) changes, API design, and testing.
What You’ll Do
Build accessible, high-performance UIs in React/TypeScript (Redux/React Query).
Ensure compliance with WCAG 2.1/Section 508 using Axe, Cypress, Playwright.
Create accessible visualizations (Recharts/D3) with ARIA support.
Collaborate on OpenAPI contracts and support small backend changes (Node/Java).
Maintain Storybook components and contribute to accessibility documentation.
Optimize Web Vitals & Lighthouse scores (code-splitting, memoization, virtualization).
Support L2 escalations and document reproducible fixes.
What We’re Looking For
3+ years of full-stack experience with strong focus on frontend React/TS.
Proven portfolio of accessible React apps (multi-step forms, tables, viz).
Experience with WCAG 2.1/508, ARIA, and screen reader testing.
Familiarity with Cypress/Playwright, Axe, Storybook.
Ability to support small backend changes (Node/Java).
Bonus Points
IAAP certifications (CPACC, WAS, CPWA).
DHS 508 Trusted Tester certification.
OpenJS (JSNAD/JSNSD) certification.
If you’re passionate about accessible UIs, complex workflows, and full-stack collaboration, we’d love to hear from you!

Confidential (Required)

title: Senior Front End Web Developer - Contract
job_description:
Candidate applying for the role
Thorium Digital is a growing digital agency that has provided services to clients from startups to Fortune 500 companies. We are comprised of self-motivated, professionally sharp and team work oriented individuals. You will be working in a collaborative and flat structured environment where there are plenty of opportunities to learn and grow with us.
The Senior Front End Web Developer must have a strong technical foundation as well as a full understanding of common coding standards, configuration management, and full life cycle systems development. This individual must have senior and lead level developer experience.
The Senior Front End Web Developer is an experienced contract remote role. The candidate must have minimum 8 years of experience working as a Front End Web Developer, and must have strong experience in React, TypeScript, and working with Node.js and Node.js Frameworks - Next.js, with some backend web experience. Must have experience working with headless CMS solution. Must have experience with Website Accessibility and building websites meeting WCAG 2.1 A/AA standards. The candidate must be able to work effectively with our client’s technical leads, our other in-house developers, and non-technical staff. This person would have strong communication skills and possess the ability to present complex technical information to a wide range of audiences, from other technical staff to senior management. Individual should be a fast learner of new technologies, be a creative thinker, share skills and information freely, and be able to mentor and train other developers.
Essential duties and responsibilities
Participate in the full project delivery, including planning meetings, estimations, design sessions and development.
Deliver project assignments on time, within budget and with high quality.
Understand and analyze project risks and provide risk mitigation.
Work as part of a team to help define technical requirements, explain the capabilities and limitations of various systems, and generate diagrams/documentation for internal and client use.
Provide assistance, training, and/or mentoring to the other developers and other team members. Document daily progress on work items & communicate to appropriate stakeholders.
Work out of hours, when appropriate, to support major implementations or to react to high priority service issues.
Guide development of tools, infrastructure, and processes within the configuration, build and release process.
Decompose high-level information into details and abstract up from low-level information to resolve solution vs. requirements conflicts.
Provide expertise in determining the strategic technical direction and system architecture for projects, as needed.
Translate design materials (Photoshop, Figma, etc.) into HTML/CSS.
Other duties as assigned.
Minimum qualifications
Minimum 8 years of experience working as a Front End Web Developer.
Strong experience in ReactJS, TypeScript, HTML5, JavaScript, and CSS.
Minimum 5 years of React experience.
Strong experience working with Node.js and Node.js Frameworks - Next.js.
Experience working with headless CMS solution. Contentful is preferred.
Experience working with Shopify, experience with Hydrogen is a plus.
Experience with Website Accessibility (WCAG 2.1 meeting A/AA standards).
Experience with SEO best practices.
Experience with performance optimization techniques for front-end code.
Working knowledge of Figma, Photoshop, and/or Illustrator.
Experience with agile and scrum methodologies.
Be detailed oriented and must be able to multi-task, manage details, and keep sight of overall objectives.
Able to work well under pressure and meet tight deadlines within a dynamic environment.
Must possess an exceptional ability to effectively communicate both verbally and nonverbally, with technical and non-technical personnel.
Strong work ethic, positive attitude, and a desire to work in a challenging position.
Individual must have a strong technical foundation as well as a full understanding of common coding standards and configuration management.
Understand the complete deployment life cycle from design, build, test, and deployment.
Experience with cloud computing configuration and administration (Vercel, AWS, or Azure).
Experience with platforms like Algolia, Dynatrace, Siteimprove, and Google Analytics is a plus.
Familiarity with one or more version control systems (Git, Bitbucket).
Technical knowledge of PHP/PHP Frameworks (e.g. Laravel or Lumen), Object-Oriented programming, design patterns, and best practices.
Excellent analytical and creative problem-solving skills.
Experience in Azure DevOps for version control and building pipelines is a plus.
Must be able to speak English fluently.
Authorized to work in the US without sponsorship.

title: Front-End Developer (.NET/Foundation)
job_description:
Job Summary
We are seeking an experienced Front-End Developer to join our ambitious and creative team. This role is for a skilled professional with deep expertise in building responsive, user-centric web applications specifically within the Microsoft .NET ecosystem. The ideal candidate must have proven, hands-on experience with the Foundation front-end framework and a passion for creating elegant, high-performance digital experiences. You will work directly with our creative team, engineers, and project managers to produce work you can be proud of.
We are not currently accepting applicants who require sponsorship to work in the U.S.

What You'll Do
Translate complex requirements and mockups into fully functional, interactive digital experiences using HTML/CSS, JavaScript, and the Foundation framework.
Develop, enhance, and maintain web pages within our existing ASP.NET (WebForms/MVC) platform.
Determine the optimal structure and design of web pages, ensuring user experience drives all design choices.
Develop new user-facing features while striking a balance between functional and aesthetic design.
Hand-code clean, semantic HTML and scalable CSS, ensuring all designs are responsive and optimized for mobile devices.
Optimize web applications for maximum speed, scalability, and compatibility across browsers.
Collaborate with back-end developers to integrate with C# and WebAPI / RESTful services.
Look for ways to improve conversion rates and implement A/B tests.
Assist with the migration to modern front-end technologies.
Required Skills & Experience
5+ years of front-end development experience, demonstrated by a strong portfolio of quality, hand-coded responsive web projects.
Deep Expertise in the Microsoft .NET Stack, including:
ASP.NET 4.8 (WebForms and/or MVC)
C#
Experience building or consuming WebAPI / RESTful Services
Required proficiency with the Foundation front-end framework in a professional environment.
Expert knowledge of core web technologies: HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, jQuery, JSON, and XML.
Required experience with Microsoft and related development tools: Visual Studio IDE and Team Foundation Server (TFS) for source control, Telerik Ajax Control Toolkit.
A passion for front-end architecture and a driven attitude towards learning new web technologies and best practices.
Preferred Qualifications
Experience with other front-end frameworks such as Bootstrap, Angular, or React.
Familiarity with JavaScript unit testing frameworks.
Who We Are
We are a team of experienced and ambitious engineers and creative people who are working on reimagining learning with a next-generation collaboration solution. We are motivated, ambitious, and ready to join forces with you to take on the digital world!

PEC provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

This is a remote position.

Familiarity with MS Access 2016 and VBA to support legacy systems during modernization
Proven experience working in Agile environments using Azure DevOps (ADO) for backlog, sprint, and release management
Completion of HIPAA and PII compliance training before assignment
Preferred Skills:
Strong ability in requirements refinement, technical documentation, and stakeholder communication
Demonstrated success in cross-team collaboration with State IT or similar environments
Prior project experience in government, healthcare, or child services IT systems
Knowledge of secure coding practices and compliance frameworks (HIPAA, PII, FedRAMP)
Experience working in large-scale modernization or legacy system migration projects

Expertise in React.js, Node.js, Express.js and/or Next.js
"Expertise in SQL Server & T-SQL "
"Experience with Azure Cloud deployments "
